result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd) and Operating w/ PAC (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • John Terry Malone Jr. was found guilty of OWI (3rd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • John Terry Malone Jr. was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).
  • John Terry Malone Jr. was found guilty of Possession of THC (2nd+ Offense), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Payment plan of $100.00 per month commencing first month upon release from incarceration or $50.00 per month if huber is received for employment during incarceration.
Huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3).
Defendant must install IID on all vehicles titled in his name and upon issuance of a valid drivers license.

miscConds.notes:
The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant may not consume/possess any alcohol.

The defendant may not enter into any bars/taverns.

timeConds.notes:
Huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3).
Consecutive to: Count 1
Must be completed within the first 18 months of probation.

records.addlTxt: Defendant John Terry Malone in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:21 PM. Also called 16CM01, 16CF75 and 16TR07. State - resolved on all criminal matters - moves to dismiss 16TR07. Court dismisses 16TR07. State - 16CM01 - dismiss outright for stated reasons; 16CF12 - plead G to counts #1, #3 and #5 and remaining to be DRI except for count #2 - dismiss that count outright, count #1 - joint recommendation of 125 days in FC jail, $2135.00 fine inclusive of costs, IID and DL revocation for 27 months, #3  - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years, consecutive to jail time on 16CF12, 270 days of conditional jail time, court costs, AODA, absolute sobriety, no possession of alcohol and no entry into any taverns, bars or similar establishments, 200 hours of community service; #5 - straight sentence of fine of $500.00 plus costs with no probation; 16CF75 - plead to count #2 as alleged, #1 - DRI, 90 days jail - concurrent to jail time on 16CF12. Scholke and Malone agree except for one minor change is that the conditional jail time should be 240 days for a total of 1 year incarceration. Court - 16CM01 - dismiss and transfer any bond posted to either 16CF12 and 16CF75. On 16CF12 - Malone pleads G to count #1, Court dismisses count #2, Malone pleads G to counts #3 and #5 as alleged, Court dismisses and reads in counts #4, #6, #7 and #8; 16CF75 - #1 - DRI, pleads G to count #2 as alleged. Malone acknowledges two prior convictions for OWI and prior conviction for possession of THC. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Scholke makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Malone makes statement, remorseful. Court sentences the defendant to the following: 16CF12 - count #1 - 125 days in FC jail - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - report today - credit for 12 days, fine of $2135.00 inclusive of costs - paid at rate of $100.00/month commencing first month upon release from incarceration or $50.00/month if huber is received for employment during incarceration, 27 month DL revocation, AODA, IID on driver's license and any vehicle titled in his name commencing upon issuance of valid DL; count #5 - $500.00 fine plus costs - paid same as count #1; count #3 - withhold sentence and place on probation for 3 years - consecutive to jail time on count #1, with conditions of: 240 days of conditional jail - huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3), court costs - paid thru probation, AODA and follow thru, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars or taverns, 200 hours of community service - to be completed within the first 18 months of probation; 16CF75 - count #2 - 90 days in FC jail - concurrent to jail time on 16CF12 - huber and good time allowed - eligible for community service under 973.09(7m) - 3 days credit, costs - take bond posted and put remainder on 16CF12, submit DNA sample, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.

Defendant John Terry Malone in court with attorney Michael Scholke.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 2:00 PM. Also called 16CM01 and 16TR07. Scholke states here for STC on CM and TR case and here for waiver on CF case. State - PH is being waived and have filed an Information that mirrors the complaint in anticipation of that. Scholke and Malone agree. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Scholke has Information, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and enters NG pleas to all counts. Court accepts plea, continues bond on all matters and sets all matter for FPT, traffic matter will track along and Scholke to represent the defendant on that matter.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 20, 2016 at 01:15 pm.

records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: Defendant John Terry Malone, in custody, in court with attorney Michael Scholke. Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:24 AM. Scholke states he is appointed on 16CM01 but not on 16CF12 yet but anticipates that he will be. Scholke has complaint on CM file, waives reading of it, enters NG plea. Court accepts plea, will set for STC.  Scholke has complaint for 16CF12 case, waives reading of it, requests PH and wishes to be heard on bond, asks for signature bond or lower cash. State - bond - no objections to signature bond. Malone informs Court that he has since lost his job due to incarceration. Court - bond - $5000.00 signature bond, no consumption of alcohol. Court - bond on 16CM01 - sets $250.00 cash that has already been posted, after no objections. Sholke waives time limits for PH. Court considers time limits waived and sets for PH. Sholke also enters NG pleas to 16TR07. Court accepts plea, follow with criminal case.  Status conference scheduled for January 28, 2016 at 02:00 pm.
